revised_title: Methods for Measuring Planetary Diameters and Star Positions
tldr: The author, M. Hook, discusses various methods for measuring the diameters of planets and the positions of stars using a telescope. He mentions that these methods can be accurate to within a second and can be used for both horizontal and inclined measurements. The author also shares observations of the star Nebulosa in the Andromeda constellation and a wondrous star in the Whale constellation.
